info.title: CollectionListing
info.description:
A CollectionListing resource represents a product collection that a merchant has made available to your sales channel. Merchants can make collections available to your sales channel directly from their Shopify admin.

You can use this resource to retrieve collections that a merchant has published and display them in your marketplace. You can also retrieve a list of published product IDs that belong to a published collection.

Note:

When a merchant makes a collection available to your app, the products belonging to that collection are not automatically made available. The merchant must make both the collection and each product available to your sales channel.

paths.description: Retrieve collection listings that are published to your app. Note: As of version 2019-07, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieve collection listings that are published to your app

200.description: Retrieve collection listings that are published to your app

x-examples.name: Retrieve collection listings that are published to your app

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/collection_listings.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CollectionListing.all(
  session: test_session,
)

paths.description: Retrieve product_ids that are published to a collection_id. Note: As of version 2019-07, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieve product_ids that are published to a collection_id

200.description: Retrieve product_ids that are published to a collection_id

x-examples.name: Retrieve product_ids that are published to a collection_id

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/collection_listings/841564295/product_ids.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CollectionListing.product_ids(
  session: test_session,
  collection_id: 841564295,
)

paths.description: Retrieve a specific collection listing that is published to your app
paths.summary: Retrieve a specific collection listing that is published to your app

200.description: Retrieve a specific collection listing that is published to your app

x-examples.name: Retrieve a specific collection listing that is published to your app

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/collection_listings/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CollectionListing.find(
  session: test_session,
  collection_id: 482865238,
)

paths.description: Create a collection listing to publish a collection to your app
paths.summary: Create a collection listing to publish a collection to your app

200.description: Create a collection listing to publish a collection to your app

x-examples.name: Create a collection listing to publish a collection to your app

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"collection_listing":{"collection_id":482865238}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/collection_listings/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

collection_listing = ShopifyAPI::CollectionListing.new(session: test_session)
collection_listing.collection_id = 482865238
collection_listing.save()

paths.description: Delete a collection listing to unpublish a collection from your app
paths.summary: Delete a collection listing to unpublish a collection from your app

200.description: Delete a collection listing to unpublish a collection from your app

x-examples.name: Delete a collection listing to unpublish a collection from your app

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/collection_listings/482865238.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CollectionListing.delete(
  session: test_session,
  collection_id: 482865238,
)

properties.description: Identifies which collection this listing is for.
properties.name: collection_id

properties.description: The description of the collection, complete with HTML formatting.
properties.example: It's a collection of curated products for the home page.
properties.name: body_html

properties.description: The default product image for a collection.
properties.name: default_product_image

properties.description: A human-friendly unique string for the Collection automatically generated from its title.
properties.name: handle

properties.description: The date and time when the collection was published. The API returns this in ISO_8601.
properties.name: published_at

properties.description:
The order in which products in the collection appear. Valid values are:

  • alpha-asc: Alphabetically, in ascending order (A - Z).
  • alpha-desc: Alphabetically, in descending order (Z - A).
  • best-selling: By best-selling products.
  • created: By date created, in ascending order (oldest - newest).
  • created-desc: By date created, in descending order (newest - oldest).
  • manual: Order created by the shop owner.
  • price-asc: By price, in ascending order (lowest - highest).
  • price-desc: By price, in descending order (highest - lowest).
properties.name: sort_order

properties.description: The date and time when the collection was last modified. The API returns this in ISO_8601.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage the collections that are published to your sales channel and retrieve their information.
